pageContext.collection_title: Milo Ryan KIRO-CBS Radio News Phonoarchive
pageContext.collection_description: This collection consists of 1,459 �" open reel sound recordings of CBS Radio News broadcasts, 1939-1962. They were dubbed from original 16" transcription discs before the latter were gifted from the University of Washington (Seattle) to the National Archives and Record Administration in the 1980s. The span of history covered by these recordings reaches form Hitler�s speech to the Reichstag on January 30, 1939, to October 22, 1962 address by President Kennedy, announcing this country�s decision to quarantine Cuba. The collection is noteworthy for containing what appears to be the only comprehensive set of recordings of Edward R. Murrow and colleagues (aka "Murrow�s Boys") reporting on the events of World War II.
